constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: SASC Strategic Area of Special Character

description: Demolition of existing building and erection of replacement 3 storey detached dwellinghouse
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: As required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the plans and details shown in the application as listed below, unless variations are agreed by the Local Planning Authority in order to discharge other conditions attached to this decision:TP(00) 01 - Location Plan - Received	18 March 2019TP(00) 02 - Block plan existing and proposed - Received 18 March 2019TP(00) 03 - existing site plan - Received 18 March 2019TP(00) 04 - proposed site plan - Received 18 March 2019TP(00) 05 - existing proposed footprint - Received 18 March 2019TP(10) 20 Rev A - Proposed ground floor - Received 15 April 2019TP(10) 00 - existing ground floor - Received 18 March 2019TP(10) 01 - existing roof plan - Received 18 March 2019TP(10) 21 - proposed first floor - Received 18 March 2019TP(10) 22 - proposed second floor - Received 18 March 2019TP(10) 23 - proposed roof plan - Received 18 March 2019TP(11) 01 - existing west and east elevation - Received 18 March 2019TP(11) 02 - existing north and south elevation - Received  18 March 2019TP(11) 21 - proposed street and west elevation - Received 18 March 2019TP(11) 22 - proposed east elevation - Received 18 March 2019TP(11) 23 - proposed north elevation - Received	18 March 2019TP(11) 24 - proposed south elevation - Received	18 March 2019TP(12) 21 - proposed section AA - Received 18 March 2019Design and Access Statement - Received 18 March 2019Energy Statement	- Received 18 March 2019Bat Emergence Report - Received 06 August 2019Ecological Appraisal Report - Received 06 August 2019.Reason:  For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The fee required for your planning application is £ 1250.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk

Prior to above ground works, architectural detailing of a scale of 1:10-1:20 along with details of all external facing finishes and materials (including specification, colour and texture) to be utilised in the development hereby approved shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be built in accordance with these approved details. (please see informatives below)Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to above ground works details of all boundary fences/gates/walls (including specification, colour and texture) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order to ensure the privacy and visual amenity of neighbouring occupiers and to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to commencement of development on site, a Demolition and Construction Management Plan (DCMP) or Demolition and Construction Method Statement (DCMS) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall only be implemented in accordance with the approved DCMP/DCMS and shall be adhered to throughout the entire construction period. The DCMP/DCMS shall provide for:(a) 	Provision for loading/unloading materials.(b) 	Storage of plant, materials and operatives vehicles.(c)	Temporary site access(d) 	Signing system for works traffic.(e) 	Measures for the laying of dust, suppression of noise and abatement of other nuisance arising from development works.(f)	Location of all ancillary site buildings.(g)	Measures to protect any tree, shrubbery and other landscape features to be retained on the site during the course of development.(h)	Means of enclosure of the site.(i) 	Wheel washing equipment.(j) 	The parking of vehicles of the site operatives and visitors(k) 	The erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate.(l)	A scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works. These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase. Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of the surrounding residential occupiers and to safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development hereby permitted details of secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development hereby permitted details of the refuse and recycling facilities shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory refuse and recycling facilities in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The car parking accommodation shall be provided on site in accordance with TP(10) 20 Rev A, 'Proposed ground floor' and shall be provided with a hard bound dust free surface, adequately drained before the development to which it relates is occupied and thereafter it shall be kept free from obstruction at all times for use by the occupier of the development and shall not thereafter be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of the development and visitors to it. Reason: In the interests of highway safety, to ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking accommodation and to avoid the congestion of surrounding roads by parked vehicles in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

No development shall commence until a landscaping scheme including where applicable the retention of the existing trees shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved scheme shall be implemented within the first planting season following completion of the development and the tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only.  Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

a) Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the proposed green roof have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.b) The green roof shall be implemented in accordance with the details approved this condition prior to the commencement of the use or first occupation of the development and retained as such thereafter. Should part of the approved green roof be removed, die, become severely damaged or diseased within five years of the completion of development, it shall be replaced in accordance with the details approved by this condition.Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the enjoyment of the occupiers of their homes in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The hard surfaces hereby approved shall be made of porous materials and retained thereafter or provision shall be made and retained thereafter to direct run-off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous area or surface within the curtilage of the property. Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding and pollution and increase the level of sustainability of the development and to comply with Policy CS1 (Climate Change Mitigation) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no extensions to the existing or proposed dwellinghouse shall be erected within the site curtilages without written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To safeguard the privacy and amenity of adjoining occupiers and maintain adequate amenity space of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, within 3 months of first occupation of the development a Post-Construction Review Certificate issued by the Building Research Establishment or other equivalent assessors confirming that the development has achieved not less than the CO2 reductions (ENE1), internal water usage (WAT1) standards equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes level 4. Evidence requirements are detailed in the "Schedule of evidence required for Post Construction Stage from Ene1 & Wat1 of the Code for Sustainable Homes Technical Guide. Evidence to demonstrate a 19% reduction compared to 2013 part L regulations and internal water usage rates of 105l/p/ day must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise agreed in writing.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation in accordance with Policies 5.2 (Minimising Carbon Dioxide Emissions) and 5.3 (Sustainable Design & Construction) of the London Plan (July 2011) and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The roof of the development hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, the gallery and balcony hereby approved shall not be used for amenity purposes until the louvred panel has been affixed to the [south] side(s) of the dwellinghouse, as detailed on drawing no.s TP(10) 21 'proposed first floor' and TP(11) 24 'proposed south elevation'. Aside from essential fixings, the louvred panel(s) shall be constructed entirely of, and retained in, obscured materials to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any materials used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable and tamper-proof, and must be replaced in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Resons: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings (other than those hereby approved) shall be formed in the side wall(s) [N and S] of the building hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be implemented and thereafter maintained in accordance with the recommendations and mitigation measures for the wildlife species protected by law as set out in paragraphs 4.4-4.9 of the approved Bat Emergence Report. Reason: To ensure that any protected species present are not adversely affected by the development in accordance with the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Please provide existing and proposed elevations for the garden wall along with a site plan at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all key dimensions for the proposed works.

Please provide an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.Under license from the Ordnance Survey six copies of an Ordnance Survey site location plan can be purchased from this Directorate for a standard fee of £30.00 payable in advance.  Cheques should be crossed and made payable to the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.  We can supply additional copies for an additional charge of 50p.  Please note that no further copies can be made when these are supplied to you.
Please provide plans as approved ensuring they are clearly labelled as approved.

Please revise draft Num.:010 99 and provide a Block plan scaled 1:500 showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.

Please revise and providea Site Location Plan at a scale of either 1:1250 or 1:2500 which identifies the site and the surrounding area and shows at least two roads and the north point. The site should be outlined in red on all copies and any other land owned by the applicant in blue.
Please complete Certificate B and return the original to this office.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed sections at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work.
Please provide details of:Validation requirements,1. 3d - Street Scene2. 3g -Details of Cycle Parking3. 3h - Details of Bin Stores and Recycling4. 3l - Tree Survey/Landscape Plan
Please confirm that your email address can be added onto our records.Please note that this was not included on the submitted application form.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed roof plans at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work.

The fee required for your planning application is £ 462.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk
Please provide revised copy of block plan scaled 1:500 showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.

Please provide revised copies of existing and proposed plans and elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.  Please note that the submitted plans/elevations do not scale correctly.

The fee required for your planning application is £ 1775.00.  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002. You may also pay online via the RBK website www.kingston.gov.uk

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

When undertaking demolition and/or building work, please be considerate toyour neighbours and do not undertake work before 8am or after 6pm Monday toFriday, before 8am or after 1pm on a Saturday or at any time on Sundays orBank Holidays. Furthermore, please ensure that all vehicles associated with theconstruction of the development hereby approved are properly washed andcleaned to prevent the passage of mud and dirt onto the adjoining highway. Youare advised that the Council does have formal powers to control noise andnuisance under The Control of Pollution Act 1974, the Clean Air Acts and otherrelevant legislation. For further information and advice, please contact -Environmental Health Department Pollution Section.

Unless clearly specified otherwise, the base of the development shown on the approved plans is taken to be external ground level, and not a Damp Proof Course or Internal Finished Floor Level. The external ground level is expected to remain consistent before and after construction of the approved development unless specified otherwise on the approved plans.

Your attention is drawn to the need to comply with the relevant provisions of the Building Regulations, the Building Acts and other related legislation.  These cover such works as  - the demolition of existing buildings, the erection of a new building or structure, the extension or alteration to a building, change of use of buildings, installation of services, underpinning works, and fire safety/means of escape works.  Notice of intention to demolish existing buildings must be given to the Council's Building Control Service at least 6 weeks before work starts.  A completed application form together with detailed plans must be submitted for approval before any building work is commenced.

Reasonable efforts have been made to check that the plans submitted for the purposes of this planning application are consistent from one to the next, and that the development hereby approved can be implemented in accordance with all of the plans submitted. Should it transpire that this is not possible and that your plans are flawed, please be clear that it may be impossible to implement this permission, and that any development undertaken which relies on this permission may be unauthorised and subject to enforcement action if expedient.

This condition is exempt from deemed discharge under schedule 6 of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition 3 - Officers are satisfied that the materials provided are in keeping with the planning permission and sympathetic to the surrounding buildings therefore condition can be discharged.

Condition 10 - Officers have reviewed the information provided and are satisfied that the condition can be discharged

Condition 16 - Tree and Landscape Officer was consulted and is satisfied that the condition can be discharged.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor works to trees mostly to the rear of the property and with no of the works negatively affecting public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor works to trees at rear of property and not affecting public amenity.Recommendation:no objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:T.1 Lime is covered by the TPO and the proposed works are acceptable and appropriate in the ongoing management of the tree.T.2 Apple is protected within the Conservation Area but not subject to a TPO. The tree is dead or dying and is a small specimen to the rear of the proerty and not affecting public amenity.T.3 Laurel is exempt from application/notification as it is not a tree.T.4 Yew - Trim to reshape by 0.5m.T.5  Wisteria is exempt from application/notification as it is not a tree.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1 Magnolia - 1m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & 10% crown thin.T.3 Yew - Crown lift to 2.5m from ground level above public footpath and raise remaining crown to match this new level.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The description of works is not sufficient, but beyond this it's intent is still clear, to reduce the trees in question by an unspecified amount, but enough to lessen the leaf fall into the gutters. The best way to prevent leaf fall into the gutters is not to reduce the trees it is to install a gutter guard to prevent the ingress of the leaves whilst continuing to allow the correct drainage of water from the roof. Furthermore, as Silver Birch do not happily tolerate reduction works and particulraly not in maturity, these works are excessive and could cause the trees to go into terminal decline. Lastly, the small branches that have fallen and are shown in the photos are simply small deadwood that is naturally produced by any tree in maturity.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1-T.3 Silver Birch - Deadwood & removal of ivy only.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works to T.2 & T.3 are acceptable and not excessive in mainting these smaller and less visible trees. The works to T.1 are more drastic, however, the tree has become excessively top heavy without any inner growth within the crown. Looking at the photos, this may be Ash Dieback taking hold or equally it may be poor past management, but either way, the works to reduce it will hopefully encourage new growth and recovery.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to maintain this large specimen tree in it's setting.Recommendation:Approve

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to maintain two pollarded trees. The hedge is exempt from application though.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Appropriate works to reduce and maintain large trees that are encroaching heavily.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:No supporting evidence has been submitted demonstrating that subsidance has taken place, no bore hole locations or bore hole sample results, no identification of live roots, no level monitoring, no photos demonstrating damage to the property in question. None of the requisite information was submitted in support of this application and in such circumstances, as the Council have not been provided with evidence demonstrating the involvement of the tree in subsidance related property damage, the Council obviously have a duty to refuse the application. I should also note that the application mentioned the removal of other close adjacent Oaks on neighbouring railway land and no evidence has been submitted that would show differentiation between the Oaks in order to demonstrate that T.5 plays any role.Recommendation:Refuse.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Works to diseased trees for health and safety reasons.Recommendation:No objection.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works to the protected Horse Chestnut are minor and acceptable. The removal of the Eucalyptus is exempt as it is not protected.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Very minor works to a small misshapen tree with no adverse impact on amenity.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor appropriate works to trees at rear of property not affecting public amenity.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are appropriate to reshape and maintain this excellent specimen tree which has become a little misshapen and is now getting very large for it's setting.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor appropriate works for ongoing maintenance to large prominant tree in setting.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor works to two large specimen trees growing in close proximity to houses. These works will have no adverse effect upon the trees and will not cause ongoing issues but rather correct issues to prevent longer term problems. The works are reasonable and measured in the intresests both of teh trees and of the residents. There is no adverse impact upon public amenity associated with the works either.Recommendation:Approve.
Details of ventilation to cold deck flat roof (C)
Foul and stormwater proposed layouts to be shown on plan including existing and proposed connections (H)
The flank wall block leaf will require a movement joint installed if over 6m long in strict accordance with block manufacture's requirements.
The cavity wall returns each side of the bi-fold doors should be a min 665 mm long. Alternatively, provide a structural engineers design to show compliance with Requirement A1/2.
A Thames Water Build Over Agreement is required for the public storm drain detailed. This agreement should be in place prior to starting work on site.
Please provide an eccentric foundation design.
The area of external openings to the extension appears greater than 25%. Please provide thermal calculations to show compliance with Requirement L.

If the boundary wall is to be retained, trial holes will be required of the wall and foundation to determine if adequate. If found to be inadequate, the foundations and wall are to be replaced (A1, C, L Vol 1)
Provide details to justify the excessive unprotected area within 1.0m of the adjacent boundary, created by the WC and Utility room door and window openings. (B4)
Venting of warm deck roof note to be omitted (C2)
3No 8000mm2 controllable trickle vents to kitchen diners (F1)

1. Specify tiles suitable for the pitch of 16 degrees shown /as pitch determined on site. (C4)2. Kitchen diners are now required to have 3No 8000mm2 controllable trickle ventilators as per the new regulations as of the 15th June 2022.   (F volume 1)
Received structural engineers details being fully approved prior to completion of those stages on site.
The local issues notice has been sent to the Inspecting Authority.
Proposed Foundation depths to be rpovided including precautions plus floor slab anti heave measures, if the extension shall be influenced by trees/ hedges in clay soils.
Provision and acceptance of smoke detector, emergency lighting, fire alarm and escape signage layouts, to relevant British Standard, prior to completion of those stages on site.
